page.title: 09WALL HALL
page.content: {Wall Hall}was obtained by The Hertfordshire County Council in 1944 after the death of {J. Pierpont {Morgan,}the famous American banker. In 1945, the first emergency Women's Teachers' Training College in England was opened by {R.A. Butler.} Wall Hall was originally the site of {Aldenham {Abbey }a 12th Century foundation. The 17th Century building was castellated in the 19th Century. {Wall Hall}now contains The Hertfordshire College of Higher Education since 1978. There are 450 full time students, all studying to be teachers. The majority train to teach in Primary Schools; but some are specifically trained to teach the deaf and mentally handicapped. Subjects studied are: {ART, BIOLOGY, {ENGLISH, FRENCH, GEOGRAPHY, MATHS, {RELIGIOUS STUDIES and SOCIOLOGY. }
